subject: Programming
title: The Mythical Man-Month
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Mythical Man-Month.

hook.text: Adding more programmers to a late project makes it even later. Fred Brooks learned this the hard way.

buildup.text: Brooks managed IBM's OS/360 project â€” one of the largest and most troubled software efforts ever.

discovery.text: His 1975 book revealed that communication overhead grows faster than productivity when you add people.

twist.text: Managers keep ignoring this lesson. Throwing bodies at a deadline remains the most common mistake.

climax.text: Brooks' Law is still quoted fifty years later because the human dynamics of teamwork haven't changed.

punchline.text: Nine women can't make a baby in one month.

quiz.question: What does Brooks' Law state?
options: Adding people to a late project makes it later
More people always means faster delivery
Small teams can't build large software
